de.mrapp.android.util.gesture

Class DragHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.util.gesture.DragHelper

  • public class DragHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A helper class, which may be used to recognize drag gestures.
    Since:
    1.4.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DragHelper(int threshold)
      Creates a new helper class, which may be used to recognize drag gestures.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDistance()
      Returns the distance, which has been passed while dragging, in pixels.
      float getDragSpeed()
      Returns the speed of the drag gesture in pixels per millisecond.
      int getStartPosition()
      Returns the position, where the gesture has been started at.
      boolean hasThresholdBeenReached()
      Returns, whether the threshold has already been reached, or not.
      boolean isReseted()
      Returns, whether the instance has been marked to be reseted, since the method update(float):void has been called the last time.
      void reset()
      Marks the instance to be reseted.
      void update(float position)
      Updates the instance by adding a new position.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DragHelper

        public DragHelper(int threshold)
        Creates a new helper class, which may be used to recognize drag gestures.
        Parameters:
        threshold - The distance in pixels, the gesture must last until it is recognized, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 0

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public final void reset()
        Marks the instance to be reseted. This will cause all properties to be reseted to default values, when a value is added by calling the method update(float):void the next time. Therefore this method may be used to start recognizing a new drag gesture, whenever a value is added the next time, while the values of the previous recognition can be still retrieved until recognizing the new gesture begins.

      • isReseted

        public final boolean isReseted()
        Returns, whether the instance has been marked to be reseted, since the method update(float):void has been called the last time. See method reset():void for further information.
        Returns:
        True, if the instance has been marked to be reseted, false otherwise

      • update

        public final void update(float position)
        Updates the instance by adding a new position. This will cause all properties to be re-calculated, depending on the new position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position, which should be added, as a Float value

      • hasThresholdBeenReached

        public final boolean hasThresholdBeenReached()
        Returns, whether the threshold has already been reached, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the threshold has been already reached, false otherwise

      • getDistance

        public final int getDistance()
        Returns the distance, which has been passed while dragging, in pixels.
        Returns:
        The distance, which has been passed while dragging, as an Integer value or 0, if the threshold has not been reached yet

      • getStartPosition

        public final int getStartPosition()
        Returns the position, where the gesture has been started at.
        Returns:
        The position, where the gesture has been started at, as an Integer value or -1, if no gesture has been started yet

      • getDragSpeed

        public final float getDragSpeed()
        Returns the speed of the drag gesture in pixels per millisecond.
        Returns:
        The speed of the drag gesture as a Float value or -1, if the threshold has not been reached yet
